reviews.review: Breakfast, brunch and more. Don't fill yourself up on a Saturday morning before leaving home as you can eat your fill here. Food from around the world is available here. Take your pick, find a seat and enjoy. In between your grazing you can wander around the design and craft shops and stalls selling unusual upmarket goods from local artists and artisans. Not easy to park nearby as it is very busy but you can get here easily by taxi or buses from the centre, including the myCiti bus 261.My favourite purchase today was tuna biltong. I bought it to take home but doubt that I will be disciplined enough not to eat it all before I leave!

Food extravaganza. Arty, colourful, a sensory delight. Although it was extremely busy you did not have to wait too long for food as there are so many options. Highly recommended. Very clean. Good ambience. Lots of leather goods on sale.

A must visit on Saturday. We visited during the month of October on Saturday.Wow! a great place to feel the local vibe. The local food market is fantastic! Regrefully only open on Saturday, arrive just before Noon - for the live music!

A super market with great products and a lovely vibe. I recently travelled to Cape Town. We spent a morning at The Old Biscuit Mill on the weekend. The market was really super. There are lots of unusual stalls with interesting goodies and the food market was just on another level! Such a great selection of foods ranging from banting to vegan to oriental to baked goods. Everything that we tasted was delicious and well-priced. Well worth a visit.

Foodies! This is your spot!. This was a really nice market, really busy with LOTS of tourists but we enjoyed all the wonderful food that is catered for everyone! Bring cash as it is easier to draw it elsewhere than here. Some stalls also use Snapscan but not all! The car attendants are overbearing, so try to park in one of the off road areas if you can, we parked way up in one of the side streets in front of a house and our car was safe. Come early as the parking really gets crazy later in the morning, also try not to go there on the first Saturday of the month as it gets extra busy! If you do not like crowds then avoid this market and rather come during the week, there will be less to see but it will be nice and quiet!

Oooohhhh the food . Don't miss it.We took a taxi from our Hotel near Kloof St, only rand70. Great place for local handicrafts also some brands & China imports (mainly in the shops), locals are in the market stall areas with high end lovely items. Go in hungry as there are so many amazing food choices, cheap and freshly made, breads, Asian, Italian, fresh oysters, cakes, fruit smoothies and much much more. Very crowded on Saturday when we visited, but the atmosphere is everything a community market should be. The buskers are delightful and fill your heart with music as you amble from place to place.Don't miss the coffee blenders or the chocolate factory .... Taste & but.
Fun way to start a Saturday in Cape-town!. We had a great time! All kinds of delicious food, great atmosphere- music, people, in one word Fun! There are beautiful shops and things to see...

Vibrant Saturday . Went to the Old Biscuit Mill to check out the Neighbor Goods market on our first day in Cape Town. It was very busy and there were so many food vendors as well as clothes, bags, etc. Didn't spend much time looking at the wares as I was busy figuring out what to eat. I wish I had come earlier and hungrier to take advantage.

Lovely market but careful of parking . My 14 year daughter and I visited this market on a Saturday morning. It was lovely and we wish we had more time to sample all the eats.My only concern is the parking. There are a number of vagrants trying to convince you to park in their spaces. One wanted R20 for a street parking! I refused but then moved my car as I was scared he would damage it in revenge.Street patrol men were fantastic and suggested safe and convenient off road parking in a college opposite the market for R10. I was incredibly grateful.
If in Cape Town on a Saturday - don't miss. Fantastic food market, with food from around the world. Gets very busy, so skip breakfast and have it here - great fun

Extraordinary "Street Food " experience . Spanish,Argentinian,Indian,Italian etc etc etc.
Caters for all tastes in an international setting made up of people from throughout the globe.
Take lots of cash as the ATM is out of the way and ridiculously busy.
The food is exceptional in quality and variety......the wine selection even better

overcrowded and over priced. I went there because of all the good tripadvisor reviews,but was quite disappointed as it was extremely over crowded and mostly tourists. I found the food over priced and the area outside of the biscuit mill chaotic and unsafe. I would much rather recommend the Granger Bay Market next to the Waterfront.

A must visit!!!!!!!!!. In my opinion one of the best spots in Cape Town! Delicious food! Paradise for everyone who's interested in unique, arty and fancy stuff!
To sum up, the best market I ever visited in my life! Thumbs up!

Great market . Give variety of markets that any good lover will enjoy.
Come early as parking is not always easy to find.
There is something for every taste.

A MUST. Although known for the Saturday morning market, we went there on a weekday and thankfully, had a good time. After having Coffee and Breakfast in a nice Cafe (forgot the name) we chanced upon a Local Chocolate manufacturing and selling company called CocoaFair. They sell delectable chocolates and chocolate related products at a very affordable prices. On inquiring further we were told that they actually import cocoa beans from Panama and manufacture everything from scratch. You can see the actual process of transforming chocolates from the coco beans in front of you.It also houses some of the best restaurants wherein the tables need to be booked 6 months prior to your visit. Sadly, we got to know about them pretty late and couldn't get any reservations. There were some nice shops selling beautiful stuff that were worth buying.

Food Paradise. If you love food, trying out different types of food or just a foodie. This is one of the best places I have been to with such a rich variety of foods. The smells, colours and visuals are a massive overload with so much of variety that you literally don't know what to try... absolute must. I promise you that pictures cannot do justice to this food market!
A must to visit. Please remember to put this market on your list. This place is fantastic and full of great restaurants. Nice place, don't miss!!!

Lovely market. We went on a Saturday to visit the market and found some great stuff. It is a worthwhile visit. We didn't think the food was as good as the Bay Harbour Market in Hout Bay though of course that is more of a hike. Would definitely be back. Aside from the market we were not impressed with the Woodstock area and couldn't find the galleries

Great market area with great restaurant, Saucelisse. We enjoyed a great breakfast at Saucelisse. The owner was incredibly friendly as she chatted with us over our vegan and Banting breakfasts. (Yay almond milk latte). The menu offers delicious breakfast sandwiches and options for all eaters. Her store was great, too and she is very Eco and socially conscious!

a wonderful and tasty venue. very cool. great food, fun environment, cool local crafts. The food choices are huge. Local ware and crafts are great for gifts and for yourself! The perfect Saturday morning.
a market with character. This is a very popular market and you can expect crowds but the food is good and the souvenir options endless.

Amazing choice of food. Guest house owner recommended a visit to the Old Biscuit Mill & glad they did. It is an amazing culinary experience with some shops/stalls thrown in for good measure. Think if you want to sit and eat would hve to get there quite early as it was a bit limited. If you drive past the Old Biscuit Mill easy to find parking rather than going where car guards are as could have quite a walk.

Delicious shopping experience!. Definitely go on Sat morning from 9-2 when all the food stalls are happening. You can grab a coffee or glass of bubbly to enjoy while you peruse all of the food options or shop for local goods.Don't miss Cocoafair on the ground floor of the silo - you can't miss the smell of their incredible chocolate and once you taste some samples, you'll surely want some to bring home. The food stalls had tons of options - wood-fired pizzas, incredible looking burgers, kebabs, fresh fruits, handmade ice cream... I could go on and on. Its definitely a popular spot but not nearly as crammed as Borough Market in London.Parking is tough - I recommend taking Uber instead.

Neighbourhodd with edge and more interesting tourist trophies to bring home from Biscuit Mill. This old Biscuit Mill offers nice small shops in one place to stroll around looking for souvenirs of better quality than in the market at the center. You avoid hawkers and can have a chat with the people in the shops. It is a nice environment to be in. If you go around the neighbourhood, Woodstock you will find something more exciting than mainstream shopping att Waterfront. There are designer shops and places with edge.

Food safari. Was advised to visit this place by Aussie co-worker, and when holidaying in SA with SA family from PE we stopped in for first time. Was more expecting general food markets, but was really surprised at the variety of food stalls and the vibe. Very packed so not something you are likely to do often, but a very great tasting experience. Will drop by again when next in CT.

Eclectic food and gift market . We were told to visit here on a Saturday morning as it has the best atmosphere; and that was definitely true. The whole place was busy with so much to look at and try. We made the most of the street food market by having breakfast, cocktails and lunch. And spent a long morning looking round all the shops and stalls. There was a large range of clothes, jewellery, leather products and homeware. While the products on offer weren't cheap the quality was excellent. Would definitely recommend the Belgian waffle stand in the food section!

Fantastic. Visiting from the UK, our friends suggested we tried the Old Biscuit Mill on a Saturday. It is Amazing!! Foods from all over the world. Sweets and Savoury, something for everyone. There was such a relaxed feel, with live music playing. One of our favourites was definitely the ice stall, watching them making it from scratch :)

Nice name. Interesting part of CPT?. Hi. This is basically a kind of street market. We enjoyed it very much. Cape Town now has many markets. The choice is yours. Close to several iconic restaurants. Take your pick.

Excellent. Outdoor food lover's market with several different types of international cuisine and foodstuff. Nice, lively atmosphere. Reasonably priced. Can get a bit packed closer to noon but overall a must have experience when visiting Capetown.
Nice market with good vibes. Spent a few pleasant hours here wine tasting, and wondering around. Not a huge market but great food and good vibe.

The place to go on a Saturday morning!. We had a wonderful time at the Biscuit Mill! Vibrand vibes! Lots of people! Wine and beer galore! You can pick and choose what you want to eat from lots and lots of food stalls. Banting, Vegan, Chinese, hamburgers, fresh salads cakes chocolates...... etc etc. The only problem is the parking. We had to walk quite a distance. Police warned us that it could be a rough area. So just put away everything in the car. But definitely worth the visit. Noise level in eatery lively.

Must visit. If you happen to be in Cape Town on a Saturday morning, this should be on your list. A huge variety of good food to choose from, prepared there and then, as well as craft beer, wine or health juice. Also some beautiful hand made crafts, like jewelry, leather goods etc. Vibey and busy.

What a great experience . My wife and I visited the Old Biscuit Mill on a Saturday morning and it was great. Excellent variety and great stores. The views of Cape Town from 2 of the vantage points was absolutely amazing.

Saturday morning . For breakfast we had steak roll from kitchen Cowboys! And the Kobe Beef burger, cannot compare the two. They were both so amazing! But the coffee has to be on top of my list! From Origin. Wow!!! Must have!! ☕️

Fantastic atmosphere. If you want to eat all sort of things stemming from different countries (plenty of food stations), it's the place to go. The atmosphere is amazing, but packed with people.. there is a wide range of art shops, craftsmen etc.. come here only if you don't mind when there are many people... Indeed it's very difficult to have a seat to enjoy your meal in this foodmarket and even for walking,it turns out to be quite complicated.

Saturday market. Open on Saturdays only. Many stores and food for all tastes. Nice restaurants and bars. Parking a challenge if not early. Secure parking available. Get too busy at times so early wake up.

Neighborgoods market. A must for anyone visiting Cape Town!!! Amazing Saturday Market at Old Biscuit Mill that gives visitors an awesome taste experience with all different kinds of foods. Shopping in the local stalls is lots of fun with great deals to be found!!! awesome time spent!!!
Yummy food and vibe . Old Biscuit Mill is best place to go on Saturday morning. Go around 8am already. Some stalls will only open around 8:30 but it's not too crowded then.

All things health, food and crafty. Best visited during the week. Mostly busy on Saturday. Limited parking. Very busy as it's located in bustling lower main road in and out of Cape Town CBD. Contains all things healthy ,crafty and flee market vibe. Food , beverages & coffee on sale all day round. Nice free spirited and open air environment . A nice 2hr visit with a difference.
Must Do on a Sunday Morning!. Lots of great food and drinks to taste from all over Cape Town! Great atmosphere and energy throughout. Fun place to attend with friends, family, or as a solo traveler.

Overpriced Artisanal Goods... A Hipsters Paradise. If you've ever been to an artisanal hipster market, don't expect anything to different. Its a cool and hip place to shop but I come from NYC and already have the Chelsea Market. I wasn't really impressed. Decent nosh but nothing I'd gush over. I may be slightly jaded as a New Yorker but don't let that stop you from visiting. Try it and report back!

Great place to visit - you must go. Good place to eat something delicious, have a huge variety of food, juices and wines.You've a lot of little stores to buy souvenirs and wear. Take some food and stay there listen to the live jazz and r&b bands.Be ponctual if you wanted to see everything. Near at miday, can be crowded. The gate close near 2pm

Superifical. The food is great but pricey and the stalls are also over priced and more or less the same items bags - shoes etc.Not much to do besides buying food and overpriced leather items. Not enough seating and activities or stalls
Rejuvenation . One of the projects that has driven the rejuvenation of the area, great restaurants, must do market, great place to work, excellent wine shop etc....
Ish. Arty facility, not very warm and welcoming atmosphere. items in shops overpriced.Not much to look at, a few restaurants closed. wont go there again.

Hipster Central!. Great shopping, though at times over priced. Some of the food vendors served a fusion of African cuisine. It was difficult to park as a foreigner, let alone walk to the market from the car without getting hassled by beggars. I am told this is normal, as well has paying a small tip to the locals who will watch your cars from getting vandalized. They aren't hard to find as they will find you! Sad sight to see all the children begging......

Excellent place for brunch/trinkets hunting on Saturday mornings. We were informed that the Old Biscuit Mill only opens on Saturdays from 9am-2pm and were highly recommended to check it out. And it was definitely worth it! This is your indie market that every city needs to have. The food selection is on par with London's Borough Market and the food offerings were amazing (thin crust pizza, breakfast in a pan, belgian waffles, shashuka, wagyu beef burgers, gourmet hotdogs, coffee, crepes, sushi, asian dim sum, korean food). We wished we could eat them all. Takeaway food offerings such as cheese, biltong, coffee beans were also available. Shopping wise - the leather crafts, home wares, gourmet chocolates, jewellery were amazing. I am particularly impressed with the quality of the leather goods here at affordable prices (if you look hard enough some vendors also offer personalisation of the leather goods and if you stay long enough you can request for a custom made item). Really enjoyed this place and would recommend going with an empty stomach.

Treasures abound. This is by far one of the best markets I've been to. Being from Johannesburg, I've been to quite a few markets. The selection of exciting food at the Neighbourgoods Market on a Saturday ranges from Mexican to Thai to delicious potjie pies to deep fried mac 'n cheese balls to rolled ice cream. And just outside is a nice bar area with live music, great spot for having a morning social. The clothes and jewellery here seem to be mostly hand made and are very trendy, worth checking out for sure.

Best place to spend a Saturday morning!. Full of diverse food options from all around the globe- pizza, vegan, healthy, brats, Dutch food, smoothies, booze, everything! Such an energetic and friendly environment with a plethora of cute shops!

Amazing stores!. This was a surprising find! We wanted a place that we could shop for a few hours and find local artists. This had a variety of stores, from pottery to clothing to art. We had a blast looking at all the offerings - including the deli for lunch. Yum!!

Hip spot, great food and coffee too. Great spot for a catch up with friends and browse some of the interesting shops. Saucisse offers some good food and baked goodies, next door is Espressolab Microroasters coffee which is amazing. The famous Test Kitchen restaurant is here too, but bookings are generally weeks ahead. There is a market on ~Saturdays until 2pm. Stalls selling local designers wares - clothes, jewellery, fresh produce etc.

Absolute must when visiting the Mother City. Second time visiting this lovely venue. Food never disappoints and the variety on offer is top class! A relaxed vibe and great place to visit for brekki or lunch. Don't miss this one!
Saturday morning must!. Espresso lab coffee, locally crafted bags/jewellery and delicious food from all parts of Cape Town. This a must do! Get there by 10am to avoid big crowds.

Artisanal Central. A gathering of local artisans and entrepreneurs exhibiting, selling, and sharing their creativity all in a repurposed & reinvigorated space. From edgy photographers and prolific craftspeople, to innovative cuisines and chocolatiers, saturdays are abuzz with excitement and discovery. Felt like the only tourist in a local hot spot - enjoying farm-to-table fare and enjoying some live music.

Shopping & food. Old Biscuit Mill is beautifully restored and gentrification in the area is underway. You can take a walk down the street a short way before hitting typical inner city vibes, and it makes for a fun outing. Go on a Saturday when the Neighbour Goods market is on - the food and choices are astounding. In the Biscuit Mill itself you'll find the famous Taste Kitchen - but beware you have to book months in advance to get a table! The Pot Luck Club is s bit better with a waiting list of a few weeks. Don't despair, the shopping and coffee shops will happily entertain you
Shopping. Went to the old biscuit mill on a Saturday to enjoy the local neighborhood market that is on. Well worth going when the market is on a there is lots of food and goods to buy and enjoy.

Great way to spend a lazy Saturday morning. We love going here for breakfast. Every one gets to pick their own breakfast and we meet up at a table to enjoy it. The Biscuit Mill really caters for every taste (and food allergy), with live entertainment and several decor shops and some stalls to boot. It does tend to get very busy, so go early to avoid to avoid most of the crowds and hold on to younger kids who tend to wander off.

What a great place... should not miss. The Old Biscuit Mill was recommended to us by a local guide. Better than we imagined! Less touristy than the Water Shed at the Cape Town waterfront, better food and better shops. Young and vibrant crowd.Must try any of the 3 restaurants on site, but the food vendors are a great alternative on the weekends. We also try a fabulous chocolate place called Cocoafair..... fantastic chocolate in many flavors!We also shopped at the various boutique stores for a lot of unique gifts/souvenirs.

Brooklyn vibe in SA. Nice shops, mostly design and art, and a few good eating spots including Test Kitchen which I did not get to eat at...the whole Woodstock neighborhood feels a bit like Bushwick in Bkn.

So much to do!. You need to go on a weekend when it's all really open. It's extremely busy but it's totally worth it. Food stalls, bespoke stalls, tours of a chocolate factory. The food is out of this world. You want to try everything but it's impossible. The vibe is brilliant, with good music!

Great food and shopping. The wine store here was excellent. The guys are very knowledgeable and friendly. Helped us find a wine we had enjoyed days earlier and had suggestions for others and they did not disappoint. They have a open air market on the weekends, great way to find crafts, clothes and jewelry from local artisans. Found a dress that I plan to live in all summer! A great stop while in Cape Town. I have a blog of all I did in Cape Town on YouTube, CeliaDW is my user name.
Lovely!. The Old Biscuit Mill is a great place to visit. A collection of shops you can get food, arts and crafts, decorations etc here. Nice

What an amazing place!. I go every Saturday to the Farmers Market near to where I live, and I thought that it was good, butThe Old Biscuit Mill is really outstanding. The quality of foods quite honestly unbelievable, and the prices very reasonable. Potato Latkes with a variety of toppings for R35, Chinese, Italian, Gluten Free, Tuna Salad, Burgers, Pies, Cakes, Salads, AND the Tuna Biltong is to die for

Fab Food, Many Choices. Loved the food here! Italian pan breakfast and churros were fantastic. Communal tables. Beautiful people. Interesting shops and music. Neighbourgoods shop local. Only open on Saturdays. Enjoy!

Good outing . Fun thing to do on a Saturday morning. Nice food. Local products. They have a bit of everything, clothes, beer, wine, music, decorations. It's definitely more expensive for Cape Town but worth the visit !

Awesome way to spend a Saturday. I spent the morning hiking Lion's Head, and heard the Saturday market was worth a trip for some lunch and shopping. Definitely worth a check, and come hungry! Great way to spend a Saturday afternoon. Market closes at 2, but the other stores were open later so just plan to hit the Sat stalls first :)

I loved it. The building, the shops, just great. Interesting goods and Saturdays there are food stands in two halls as well - great choice of food from a lot of different countries all over the world. Fantastic.

Food Market On Saturday Is Amazing. The Food Stalls that set up here on Saturday are just incredible. From local delicacies to exotic food from all over the world there is something for everyone here. It is a feast for the eyes as well as the people watching is incredible. A not to be missed highlight of any visit to Cape Town.It gets crowded but there are so many choices that the lines at any individual stalls are quite manageable.

Great shopping and food!!!. It's in Woodstock, a part of Cape Town you might not discover if you are a tourist...The adults and the kids (6 and 9 yrs old) had a lovely morning. It's lively, it's colourful, you find special gifts (art, jewels...), cool music in the background and you can taste many different food!

Saturday morning breakfast YES!. Breakfast at Old Biscuite Mill is a treat to anyone who like good food, snacks, healthy smoothies and LOTS of people. Many students turn up here on a Saturday around lunchtime so try to get there earlier - with an empty stomach!

SATURDAY MORNING BRUNCH here. I dare you not to go to this....a real highlight - opens at 10 but don't go until 11 am if you can and eat it all.....flowers, veg, homemade chocolate, cheeses, cupcakes, food and food and food that all is delicious! I wish it was open every day!

Very trendy place. Lovely selection of shops and places to eat but parking can be quite a challenge and is VERY expensive - we expected to pay about R5, for under an hour only to be confronted with a request for another R10!!! That is R15 for 30 - 60 minutes, must be one of the most expensive in the city for sure. . We visited Saucisse Deli which is a real treat but service is somewhat slow as everything is made to order and the staff don't seem to have a very good system going. However once we got the custom made sandwiches, we were very pleased. Coffees must be ordered from next door, (competition I guess) , but they are very good,

Morning market. Amazing. Loved this place. Go early. We were there at 9 and busy but it got busier and go hungry. Great place to start the day. Food is terrible main attraction with a few shops and heard the wine shop is great.

Something for Everyone. . Definitely a must visit in Cape Town. The Saturday morning market is always busy and is bustling with excitement. Live music is often playing and the atmosphere is electric. Whether you're looking for food, flowers, home supplies, clothing or groceries, the Old Biscuit Mill has it all. I dare you not to buy anything.

Street market with good food. This market is full of shops with jewelry, clothing, restaurants, coffee shops, korean and chinese food,smoothies,,hummus,caks,nats,vegetables. Great music and performances, good price,a lot of fun.open only on saturday

Crazy good place on saturday. Def go on a weekend. Music playing, open air food cooking, tons of choices, great artisan markets. Too many food choices. Walk thru & then decide. Long tables for everyone to sit. Park on Greatmore and Kent. $ 20r for the day. The guy was great and we came back with a car still intact. Fun place to take kids even. Just go and people watch- they are from all over the world.!!!!!

Morning visit. This is the most crowded and most overrated local attraction. They certainly need bigger premises to do all the amazing food stall owners justice. We headed to the famous pizza man and had to push our way through hords of people. The pizza was delicious.....

Saturday Market at Must!. By about 9:45 AM things are bustling at the Old Biscuit Mill Market where there are artisans, craft people and a glorious and varied food market. Sadly, we had already eaten a full breakfast, but there were tons of food stalls selling everything from beautiful locally sourced organic salads, beautiful grilled mushrooms, Indian food, middle-eastern food, burgers, sausages, great fresh brewed coffees, even freshly fried latkes topped with a fried, egg, salad, avocado, you name it. My husband bought a lovely leather briefcase & I got two delicate gemstone necklaces for gifts. A very cool place!

Good vibe but chaotic. Stopped by at 11am on Saturday morning, I've been during the week and it was a pleasant place. During the Saturday market it's absolutely chaotic by 12pm - nowhere to sit and enjoy your meal and evening moving around becomes difficult. Parking is also a nightmare with loads of people harassing you for parking fee's. We walked out and enjoyed a meal across the road at the Deli. The farm markets are better positioned to allow more visitors and seating space.

Churros and Smoothie heaven. This is a genuine cornucopia for the senses - something for everyone and a lovely busy vibe. We enjoyed tasty authentic dim sum, but were blown away by the awesome churros and stunning mango smoothies on offer. No wonder the place is heaving with tourists and locals alike. Love!

interesting shops and places to browse. pricey but more fun than the waterfront. Wonderful places to eat if you can get in (the pot luck club has great food and informal atmosphere but hard to get into...). Chocolate makers let you taste. What is not to like?

Lovely for a day trip outing. Lovely setting with a view of the mountain
Many different food delicacies to choose from. Very artsy, some crafts available too
Perfect for travellers and visitors, locals might find it a little pricey
Live band performances
many varieties of beers on sale.
Definitely something for everyone

Overated. Extremely busy on a Saturday and extremely expensive. This is cape towns version of the neighbour goods market. the food looks great but the experience is frustrating, cannot walk through the aisles. more of a tourist trap than anything else. no place to sit and enjoy the surrounding. Its fun but not exciting. the atmosphere is electric

Loved this place. Go on the weekend when all the vendors are there and this place is hopping. Wow - the variety of food was almost overwhelming. You have to walk through the entire place first THEN decide what you want to eat.

FOOD FRENZY. Just absolutely amazing. But go on a Saturday for the food vendors they are excellent!! If you get a chance check out to Chocolate store they serve up a mean hot chocolate and have got some great samples.

Be warned to take care of your belongings.. What a great buzzing place filled with independent shops, stalls and eateries! Food starts with beverages and up to top quality restaurants. The stalls and shops also a huge range from typical African mementos to fashion. We chose to sit in the big eating area where you can select and buy food and drink and take to a table if you can find a space. It gets busy...We were having rather a good time only to find our travel bag was stolen. So please take care, this can happen in any city and here it is easy to feel comfortable.

a feast for the eyes .... intoxication for the nose....and a boquet for the taste buds!. Saturday morning at the Old Biscuit Mill takes you on a culinary journey around the world! From latkes with smoked salmon to seafood paella and to inventive sandwiches and flatbreads this is where you want to start your day! Yum!

A taste for everyone. We happened to be driving passed and decided to stop. Parking is a mission with chancer car guards. The market itself was a wonderful experience and delight to my taste buds. Definitely worth a visit again.

Excellent place to visit on Saturday or any other day but Sunday!. Cocoa fair - a real hot chocolate, chocolate ice cream, coca beans in chocolate, coffe beans in chocolate. All delicious. Other places in Old Biscuit Mill - good restaurant, design, furniture or craft shops. Good place to watch people and vibrant atmosphere. Good place to be and spend minutes and hours. Food market on Saturday (8:00-14:00).

Amazing market atmosphere. We were there on a Saturday morning .... great variety of foods, clothes, accessories, souvenirs can be found at reasonable prices...attractive to visit ....must spend a minimum of 2 hrs to see all shops... good atmosphere, but too crowded at times...Michele & others
Large crowd. Try visiting during the week, weekends get large crowds. Nice foods & clothes are for sale. You get extraordinary food & clothes which is appealing.

Packed to the gills, but worth it!. I headed to the Neighbourgoods market twice while in Cape Town, and regretted that it wasn't on during the week so I could've gone more. No matter what you're after, you'll find it here, be it food, drink, clothing, accessories, even furniture!While it's not particularly close to the city (I was staying in Long Street, and it took me a solid 30 minutes to get to the Mill by train), it's worth the trip.

Great Atmosphere. If you are hungry this is the place to go. On a Saturday morning forget breakfast as you will be spoilt for choice with all kinds of different cuisine on offer. The atmosphere is amazing and there is a wide variety of art shops selling goods to take home to furnish your home or as a present. In the middle of the hustle and bustle is live music to add to the fun. So venture here on a Saturday morning. Not to be missed.
Crowded. Too popular and crowded for my liking. Quite expensive too. Still attractive enough to visit, but other markets now more authentic.

Amazing. This is one of my favourite places in cape. The market on Saturday is fantastic. Everything I ordered there was exceptional quality. It's got a really cool vibe, live music, natural food. If I lived in cape, I'd be there every Saturday

One of the coolest places in SA. It is a must see on a Saturday for the color , multinational spirit and the amazing food. In my opinion the prices are reaaaly low, you can have a glass of wine and roam around different cuisines from all continents, you can chose the most appetizing ones and sit with your friends or with strangers. They also sell artizanal products , i really think it is a must do when in Cape Town.

Boho hangout. For a totally chilled vibe, terrific food, great assortment of cheeses, coffee, friendly-friend-making place. ... You've arrived! The process are pretty average to a bit expensive but oh so worth it! !! I have only had good experiences and you can take your dog (s) and kids. The best part for a dog lover like me.Sit on a bench at a long table with strangers or tuck yourself and your tribe into a corner whilst sitting on bales of hay.Parking can be a problem, so go early and please be safe. Not the greatest area in Cape Town but a great treat

Food-Lovers Heaven!. Although I have been to Cape Town lots, it was my first visit to the old biscuit mill market and I wondered how I was able to miss it so many times before! Really great food! Definately go there on an empty stomach and enjoy the abundance and variety! The stalls represent food from many different countries, depicting Cape Town's multicultural background!

A Saturday must visit! . What a great place to eat! Anything from pasta, smoothies, juices, real coconut water, beer, wine, oysters, fish, waffles & chocolate! The Neighbourgoods Market is open till 2pm on Saturdays! This will have a ton of vendors.

A whole lot to eat... In a nutshell, hippy funky deli vibe foods from many parts of the world meets here on every Saturday. Make sure u come in super hungry coz there are tons to eat here. Food taste from average to very good.

Fabulous food market!. Before we went there, I read the comments here on TripAdvisor about how busy it can get and how difficult it is to park in a decent place. So we got up early just to be there when it opened. We actually got there a quarter to 9 and parking was not an issue for us at the time. Oh be sure you go there with an empty stomach. All the food was just great! Everything we ate was fantastic. Mushrooms, dim sum, just fantastic!
excellent. Each Saterday visiting the Old Biscuit Mill is great. Love this place.I have recommended it to al my friends and family.

So much food, so little time!!. This has got to be my favourite market in SA!! ALL the food is good and you just never have enough time or place in your stomach to try enough of it. The best food in the market for me is the Pork-belly pies, but then again I have not even tried half the food in the market. A must for lovers of great street food!!

Best known for its Saturday morning market. I think the food market is only on a Saturday morning - lots of stalls selling a wide variety of street food. There are also shops selling clothes and craft goods that must be open all week and also restaurants and live music. It is fun and vibrant and you can easily spend half a day here. I believe you can get to it by bus but it is easy by car too. There are pretty well organised guys who will find you a parking space and look after your car. It seems to work ok and only costs a pound or so and seems safe. One of the top restaurants in town is here too.
Fun Saturday market . Great option for food and shopping on Saturday mornings. Arrive early since it gets crowded. Lots of options of food and live music.
Great Spot . Great Food and coffee! The variety of food stands is amazing and the food is delicious! We went here at 9:00 and left at 12:00. Not necessarily African style place but just very cool!!

Fantastic food and goods market. This is such a great place! Go for breakfast, brunch or lunch, there are dozens and dozens of food stations cooking up fantastic food. Meander through stores and stalls selling local goods, and take in the wonderful atmosphere. Great morning, Saturday's only.

Love weekends at the Old Biscuit Mill!. The food hall at the Old Biscuit Mill is a crazy crowd of amazing smells, sights and flavours that is the melting pot that is South Africa. I love coming to the Biscuit Mill, grabbing a bite or a cold drink or coffee and then wondering the shops in the market area as well as on the streets that border the Biscuit Mill. Lots of quirky art stores, a great central flea market/local artisan crafts section where I always (happily) spend more than I intend! A must visit on any weekend in Cape Town.

Great place to visit for an afternoon. Even during the week.. Great and interesting place to visit for the afternoon. You can get the 102 bus from central Cape Town and get off at the 'Kent' stop and then walk about 2 or 3 minutes. It really is worthwhile. Great Shopping, good Food, interesting People.

Too good. This place has a lovely market that has amazing jewelry clothes and whatnot. Also a multicultural foodmarket. It is expensive though so be careful because its impossible to resist all the beautiful products that are sold ;)
Wonderful atmosphere. Every weekend. Culture and food market. A lot of people. Wonderful atmosphere. crowded but not too much. Try to come early.

If Austin, Texas had this, it would be more famous than Franklin BBQ. If I could take 10 people to this place that are foodies it would start a revolution in the USA. Why don't we have something so magical? I don't understand.First - it is only on Saturday! So you have to get there! Plenty of local street parking.Second - you see all of the pop up tables and chairs magically appear if you get there early.Thirdly - as the crowds start forming and the food starts being cooked you will think you are in a food orgy and be very happy.I saw GIANT pans of paella cooking in the open air, stalls of fresh mushrooms that you can take away fresh or purchase as a kabob cooked over a fire.A wood stove in the back of a truck to cook fresh pizza - made to order. I had the fresh oysters from the Atlantic Ocean from Mother Shuckers Oysters! Served with a champagne shooter. OH DIVEN!Plates piled high of Mediterranean cuisine!, Fresh sushi next to an Eggs Benedict station, next to a flower stall, next to a pastry seller, beside a mile high meatball sandwich vendor and the smells are all just making your mouth to want more!I saw fresh cinnamon sticks as long as your arm! All different colors of fresh local honeys. Buckets of freshly cured olives and stalls of bread that you just wanted to take home! Oh my! I am hungry just thinking of the glorious bounty!Do put this on your must do list if you are a foodie and plan to eat a few meals that will last you for the entire day.There are also many local vendors near by selling hand made shoes, stone carved birds, horn items, and sunglasses! A little bit for any local or traveler! Don't miss this and get there early!I also ate the day before in the SAME - OLD BISCUIT MILL building at the Pot Luck Restaurant. Finest in the land...but hta tis

Normal midweek visit was not really worth it.. We went there midweek rather than Saturday. Yes there was hardly anybody unlike Saturdays but there was not much to see either. A few shops and cafés, that is all. It was rather boring. Would not recommend a midweek visit.

Even Better Than Expected!. We planned to visit the Old Biscuit Mill and the market after seeing it on a blog. What a fun experience! The food was amazing- we ate breakfast and lunch there, then got a variety of foods to take back to our rental apartment for dinner. We also found a unique duffel bag to take back as a memory of our time in Cape Town- excellent craftsmanship! It's easy to grab a taxi there and back. I would go here every weekend if we lived in Cape Town. Highly recommended!

Fancy Flea Market. There are wonderful little shops and stands selling custom made goods from jewelry to clothes to stationery. Most of the are hand made so expect to pay a bit more than usual. On Saturdays the food market is open and you can have your selection of delicious food and treats but on other days there are a few restaurants to grab a bite to eat. I recommend you go early on a Saturday morning as parking can be very difficult to find and the Mill gets very busy and crowded by late morning.
Relaxing. A few specialist little shops which are cool to browse around You sit and have something to eat. limited safe parking.

Lovely socalising experience. This is a vibrant market which has a variety of food and crafts for everyone. A bit pricey, but a good experience. So if you enjoy the hustle then it's definitely worth a visit.

A bit expensive but worth it. It's just a really nice place to hang out, have a coconut, and share different foods with friends or family. There's a lot to discover and a good vibe. One of my favorite things to do to start into the weekend.
Brief Visit.. Lots of interesting crafts work to see. Didn't get to try any food items. It was too crowded and that cut short the visit.

Gentrificated. I've got a love-hate relationship for these kind of places.There's good coffee, organic stuff, things marked as vegan, a lot of fresh good food.At the same time, it also sets a kind of atmosphere and draws a certain kind of people to it.Do not expect a "authentic" market.

Worth coming only on Saturdays. Only on Saturdays they have the famous market on! With lots of delicious food and local fashion designers! Been there during the week but it does not have the same vibe as i was there on a Saturday

Foodie heaven!. I only had 2 1/2 hours at the Biscuit Mill and I could have stayed all day. I loved the sights, the smells and of course, the food. We got to the Biscuit Mill about 10:00 on a Saturday. It got very busy very fast. I wanted to stop and taste at every booth. The food was beautiful, colorful, unique and delicious. I tasted Raith (a local butcher) bacon and frankfurter on a cauliflower wrap, spicy cream cheese, and a latke. There was so much more that I would love to have tried! There were wonderful teas, coffee, lotions, spices, clothing, and more. I loved every minute of it!

Too busy. Perfect spot for international tourists (which I am not). Lots of good South African food for sale plus other food options. The problem is the venue is way too small. We walked around quickly to grab something to eat then left just to get away from the crowds. And we got there as soon as it opened! Why don't they move to a bigger venue? It has outgrown the old biscuit mill. I also think they need to get more vendors, people that aren't just selling food.

Fun to do on Saturday Morning. We got up and went there during our last day and bought a few things. Bought my son a cool bathing suit. The best part was the food as it was really good and interesting. Very crowded and hard to find a place to sit but incredibly clean and felt very safe. A better version of the Brooklyn food fest every weekend.

Great vibe but few glitches. Second time iv been to old biscuit mill and i love the vibrant atmosphere and so many delicious looking food to choose from. But i think things are generally overpriced and overpacked with people so finding a seat to eat is difficult. The car guards annoyed the life out of me because we paid R25 when we parked and when we got back another car guard came to demand R50 from us!! Then he pestered us for 10min demanding that we must pay him and when we refused he cursed us and walked away which was really unpleasant. Think they need to come up with something more fair and regulated. Otherwise, it IS a nice vibe, lots of food to try so yes, i would recommend going there but maybe take uber or something even if it might cost you a bit more.

Saturday morning must !. The Old Biscuit Mill is a must in Sat. Mornings . There are a ton of different independent vendors with all sorts of goods,ie: handmade clothing ,shoes,bags ,etc . & there is also a separate tent area for foodies ! This market is amazing and there was something for everyone's different taste buds ,and they also had live music ! They had absolutely every food you could think of , and all delicious ! Go on an empty stomach so you can try everything !

Wake up early and get over to OBM!. Can get incredibly crowded. Preferred to get up early and beat the masses of tourists that flock to OBM on the weekends. Great for everyone - food (brunch!), jewelry, photography, arts & crafts stores.

Great Place to visit Saturdays. Great food stands and outstanding atmosphere for shopping too. You can park straight on the road. Check-out the "Saucisse" restaurant offering fabulous food and drinks, sitting in the courtyard.
A MUST when visiting CT. Go hungry because there is so so so so much to try! The shopping is a bit more sparse than you would expect but it was great for what was there.

Biscuit Mill. For a different and classy market experience this is the place! Don't go looking for the cheapest wine in town, rather very good and drinkable selections. Classy eating places with trendy and artistic clothing and goods to browse. Very accessible and in town with something for the whole family.

Interesting place. Good to explore. Not great for kids or families with prams. Took packed. Lots to try out but don't surprised when it looks far better than it tastes. Unfortunately most vendors are better at presentation than flavour.

Disappointed . We went there today and firstly the parking was ridiculously expensive at R10 for 30 min ... The shops seemed generic and all sold the same things with the exception of the bead shop and photography shop

Worth the visit. We went to the Old Biscuit Mill for lunch and can certainly recommend it. There are some nice shops and a lot of street food stands. We had a lovely burger and local beer. You'll have to accept the queue that comes with such a popular place :-)

Nice, overpriced shops. We visited in the last week of December, thinking its a nice time killer! Loved walking around in the permanent shops, however they are way over priced. The food at the restaurant looked appetizing but definitely not worth the money they were asking... Sandwiches about R85... No stalls and open market in the middle of the holidays... Will go back when it has that some time over a weekend. When the stalls are not there, rather put your visit off until the weekend when it's functional.

Love this craft-trend. Just love these markets where people exhibit their skills and passion. This place is a market with thousands of interesting, passionate craft products (food and drinks included) on sale. Mark this down as a must once a month.

This is a must if you are in Cape Town. A friend of mine, who lives in Cape Town, recommended me this place and he was absolutely right! what a wonderful place!. My recommendation is that you visit the place on Saturday and you should arrive in the morning. On Saturdays you will not only experience all the amazing stores and restaurants but you also will be able to get the best selection of food and beer in the Neighbour Goods Market. Prepare yourself to be there for several hours because there is so much to eat, drink, listen, and see; it is a truly incredible local experience for a visitor. If you are a coffee lover, I definitely will recommend you to start your day having a delicious cup of coffee at Espresso Lab Microroasters (it is is yummy and the staff is super friendly). If you would like to shop high quality artisan products, mainly made locally, please visit Saucisse Boutique Deli, this is a lovely family own deli and they truly have fantastic products including olives, chili sauces, marmalades, to name a few. You should not leave Cape Town without coming to this place!
Worth a visit. Some really interesting and unique shops and crafts. The biscuit mill has a really cool vibe and some excellent restaurants

Nice way to spend your Saturday morning! . A wide variety of stores that sells food and individual unique store. Had the pizza and waffles- both delicious.A great way to immerse yourself with the background music and ambience. Highly recommend you drop by! Also a picture perfect place for photographers! We took a cab to and fro and was easy. Recommend you do the same.

Trendy and interesting . The Old Biscuit Mill is a great place to visit. A number of very good restaurants; some really cool and unique shops, and a great market on Saturdays. A super South African authenticity and a very good place to find some unique gifts or souvenirs if your a visitor to Cape Town.
Awesome Burgers and chocs. Awesomeness be back . Great time . next time Market all around ....... Come over weekend and enjoy ...............................................

Fun and delicious!. This is a must for your visit to Cape Town! Bustling market with shopping and a wide array of food and drink choices. Walking around and sampling is part of the charm of this market. Great place to spend a Sunday morning!
Fantastic. . We had great time at the Biscuit Mill. Food stalls to suit all palates and a great selection of drinks - both alcoholic and non-alcoholic. We'll worth a visit!
Trendy/artsy. I would say it's trendy and artsy. A cool place, good things to see, at the same time you can simply relax there. The place has great vibes.

Food glorious food. Not a market in the traditional sense with most being in established premises but the food area is where this market stars. The 'stalls' are established shops but with some great wares in them. Not a huge variety though across the board. But the food, oh wow the food. Your nostrils are excited the mint you walk into this area, hit food, cold food, somewhere in the middle food. I suggest not eating before you go here as if you don't get sucked in by the samples on show you will get bamboozled by one of the desserts and not be able to help yourself. Fantastic entrepreneurs outside also that will find you a car park, even if it means going the wrong way down a 1 way street.

Awesome food and vibe!. This is an awesome food market in the woodstock area, open on saturdays, paid a visit after a hectic night out before so was a shock to senses and made you feel awake, the smells, live music and great vibe!tge foods from around the world that are right at the back is awesome, probably the best part of it, had a gourmet burger at the far right corner when u enter, was awesome. A must do on every trip to CT!

So much food to choose from!. We went there early Saturday morning with an empty stomach. The average price range was R45 to 80 for really a tasting of the food so the portions weren't large at most of the stands, but there were a large variety to choose from. It was packed to the brim, and there was also some nice live music. They also had some nice boutique shops filled with artsy goods but they weren't cheap!
Place to be on a Saturday . A great place with great food! Loved it! Definitely value for your money! The best thing is that most of the food is freshly prepared and one can get to see how it's made!

Must go! Not to be missed!. Go early on a Saturday morning and cater for about 3 hours for a full appraisal of the place. Personally we feel that Old Biscuit Mill has more to offer as compared to Hout Bay weekend market. There are more food options, and there are more variety of goods for shopping as well!There was live music when we were there, a neighborhood goods market where you can purchase fresh produce, more food in the premises. Items are affordable, but do pack more money as you will be eating throughout the trip. This place is out of the town central area, we got a cab to pick us up to and fro our hotel. About 15 to 20 minutes drive from Cape Town central.

Place to be @ Sundays for foodlovers. This old bicuit mill has been transformed to a food court. All types of breakfast and healthy foods to order and taste upfront, of course. Smoothies, big breakfasts, pancakes, etc etc etc. Very nice atmosphere, where we all sit at long tables. Many locals will visit this food court. Parking your car is an issue, so local transport is advised (but maybe you are as lucky as we were...)Be early (from 0900 am) because this attraction is very much liked and therefore it will become crowdy after 1100

If you are a Foodie, you will love this place. If you are looking for a local spot that has lots of food and drink options from local vendors, this is the place for you. If you are looking to do a lot of shopping for local products, this is not the place for you. We thought it would be a much bigger venue (something like Pike Place Market in Seattle). We got there early on a Saturday and it was packed. The food was delicious. There's something there for everyone! Don't try to drive there from Cape Town. Take a taxi or Uber. The parking is very limited and expensive.

Terrible, packed, nasty parking attendants,. We were told this was the place to go on a Saturday morning to enjoy a nice and relaxing food market and art and craft shopping experience. Well, it took us over 30 minutes to find a parking space, then we had to deal with a very special parking attendant. The market place was absolutely packed, could not walked to the food corner. The rest of the different buildings are interesting as buildings but shops are selling absolutely rubbish stuff, never saw so many scarves in my life. It was like being in London Underground on rush hour. Then we were almost verbally abused by the same parking attendant as we told him 10 rand was far too much for less than 45 minutes on a free parking space. Never again !! Rubbish.

Overrated and unsafe area. We took a cab there on Saturday, it was very crowded in/out of shops and we could barely enter some shops. If you'd like to "shop", visit during the week. Otherwise it's just a trendy spot to gather for cocktails in a dodgy area. We decided to walk to an outside spot for coffee ( long lines inside). There was a nice coffee shop not far away. The entire area is very dodgy, after leaving the coffee shop a group of youths tried to steal our backpacks, we yelled and fought them off and some locals driving by stopped their cars in the road, one wonderful women drove us out of this area. If you feel the need to go, take a taxi direct to/from the entrance!
Nice time . Biscuit mill is a really nice market but some things are expensive but otherwise it is really nice and has great chocolate places. It's the second best market ever

Visit on saturday. Visit the Old Biscuit Mill on saturdays when The Neighbourgoods Market is happening. This place is a shopping area for design, African arts, souvenirs and fashion and musical concerts.You'll find fresh and organic products from local farmers, great food from many countries for breakfast or lunch and a great coffee shop called Espressolab.

Oh the smell of glorious food!!!. This place gets very busy and rightly so. The selection of different food stalls is enormous and they all look great. The variety of different cuisines will cater for anyone. At the end, wash it down down with a tasty bloody Mary. Cauition though, our car was broken into whilst we dined. I would highly recommend traveling by taxi to the venue in order to avoid the bitter taste left in our mouths by this senseless theft.

food court stand "For the love of Yummyness" crepes and waffles. Great food for breakfast, lunch or when you're in for some sweet treats! I like all items at the menu, especially the waffles. Go for a cup of coffee and buy yourself a freshly made waffle or crepe! Really delicious and for a very good price!

Chocolaaate. Lovely market!! A lot to see and to eat! A lot of great people as well!You should also take the tour through the chocolate factory! Its half an hour for only 50 rand!! And you can taste all the chocolate! Its amazing!!
Best food!. Best place to taste South African quality food! You find very fresh and organic products and people from different countries. Saturday is the best day to go.

Center of trendy Woodstock. Complex of former industrial buildings, now used as office shareground and shopping area for design, African arts and souvenirs and resraurants. One of the Must-goes in Cape Town.

Organic at its best. At least once a month I go to the Old Biscuit Mill (to meet some friends :-) and to catch up on gossip and trends. It is a fabulous place to meet, great place to eat and generally just chill from your usual routine. Parking is a hassle though so if you are lucky enough to find a decent parking you are set for an amazing experience.

Fun day out BUT get there early. This was a fun way to spend a Saturdaymorning wandering around the various food stalls with much to delight the eye and stomach.There is also a section which allows young designers to exhibit their products plus some quirky and interesting shops.The only drawback is the lack of parking. Although we got there early it was a long walk from the car to the market. However on the way back we discovered all sorts of little shops along the main road which were really different. This area has recently been revamped and made really interesting.

African flavours at its finest. WOW, what an experience to enjoy this rejuvenated industrial complex, and they did a fine job of it, keeping both old and new working together. Everything is represented at the market, clothing/fashion, arts & crafts, jewelry, leather goods. Lets not forget the fantastic food and music. You can surely spend the whole Saturday at the market. what a great time we had, glad we were part of the experience.

Soooo worth it. I absolutely love this place and would go every weekend of parking wasn't such a struggle! There are so many different stores and each one is as amazing as the next. However, the potato rostis with poached egg for breakfast are out of this world, and the Mediterranean salad bar in the back section is indescribable! There is such a range (waffles and the Creamery ice cream to Asian and paella) and there isn't something that you won't like. The clothing section outside is also stunning and unique. Definitely worth a visit, whether local or international. However, if you're going for breakfast try getting there quite early - it gets very full! Such a lovely atmosphere.

FOOD, FASHION, ART... and crowds. An amazing lifting of this industrial complex, that became very trendy three to four years ago and still attracts crowds. Saturday mornings are THE day to go, for a fantastic food market (hmmmm... the mushrooms brochettes!... and the French cheeses !) but be prepared to queue at each stall and to meander in the halls.

The place to be on Saturday Morning!. We had the opportunity to go to the Old Biscuit Mill after hearing rave reviews. We are so glad we did. Arrive with an empty stomach and enjoy countless types of food from all around the world. From fresh juice and smoothies, to mushroom kebabs, Dim Sum, oysters,paella, desserts and so much more. So many wonderful places to eat so little space in my stomach. We enjoyed live music (on this particular weekend one man with his electronic keyboard and diggity doo). We shopped in all the shops and bought some fun souvenirs. A safari inspired pillow cover (easier to stuff in a suitcase then the whole pillow) from Art Lab a digital print shop with wonderful images for sale from stickers to wall art and everything in between. Although we had nice weather this might be a good place to go on a rainy day as most of it is covered.

great food and market. everything that cape town has to offer all rolled into a market, Saturday is the most popular day, offering food, drink, arts and crafts and handwork, relaxed and friendly atmosphere, a short taxi ride from down town Cape Town

A cacophony of African flavours!. Go hungry, for breakfast or lunch. A fantastic array of foods from shaved yoghurt, to Kobe burgers, to sushi, to great coffee and hot chocolate......this is the place to go on Saturday 9-2. Also a small but good market of quality handmade items. I bought a leather purse 600 rand, and scarf 200 rand. Food for everyone! Enjoy.

Fantastic indoor "street" market . Every Saturday is when all the food vendors setup. It seemed to have everything which made it difficult to decide. We made several loops for over an hour until finally ordering. It did not disappoint. The only drawbacks are the massive crowds and the oppressive heat inside. Live music was an enjoyable experience.

Best Food Market in CapeTown. Make sure you go for the Saturday market and go hungry as the food stalls are amazing and there is just too much choice!!! The value is incredible as well and the setting is really quirky!
Street food heaven!. The perfect place to spend your Saturdays!Art and photo galleries, and lots of street foods! The hardest thing is to choose what to eat, there are too many things!!!

Not so interesting during week. Unfortunately we were unable to visit on Saturday which is apparently when the action is happening. During the week there are some cute shops but not much else. Probably up and coming.

A treasure trove of amazing shops and services! A must visit..... A mate of mine recently invited me to the Biscuit Mill for some catching up time....when we were there we visited 2 places that made me realise what an amazing and unique place the Biscuit Mill is. We first visited Cocoa Fair and waited for our hot chocolate we ordered....watching it being melted and prepared...yumm! Also - an artist made Smaug the Dragon entirely out of chocolate.....hope it is still there! We then went to the very quaint Saucisse Boutique Deli - the owner/co-owner's Dad was a bubbly gentleman and kept us intrigued with where they sourced their food and products....I wanna grow old like him....excellent food! Great place, I'm going back with my family soon.
Perfect Saturday hangout. The place to be in Cape Town on a Saturday, great food, atmosphere and located in the coolest part of town: Woodstock! Go there you will not regret it!

Really a fun place to visit. The shops here are all atypical of the usual stuff found in malls. I recommend at least an hour if not more to soak up the atmosphere and enjoy discovering new quirky things in the variety of shops. Parking is available in a dedicated open lot and tends to fill up quickly but attendants are on hand to assist.
Best food market. Tried so many different delicious things. Amazing food and amazing drinks. Great people. Live music also great.

Craft & Food Market . This market is separated into two parts: crafts and food. It was fun to look through both. The food side has many ethnic stalls and many offer samples. We decided to get the mushroom skewers (absolutely delicious), mixed nuts, and charsu bao (not that good - no samples here to know what you were getting). A bit eclectic but good. We didn't spend too much time on the craft side but they had art work, children's clothes, jewelry, wall decor, and so forth. It was interesting to browse.

Really nice place for food, photography, music and arts and crafts lovers. You would never think to discover this in Woodstock. It is a really nice market that is perfect for people that like arts and food. There is such a great variety of food so whether you want Chinese, Thai, Spanish, Belgian waffles etc, you can find it there. And enjoy your meal while listening to live music or you can just stroll through the galleries as well.

Food place nice. The food court is nice and here are a lot of interesting and yummy things to eat and drink! The rest of the market is ok, a little bit too much commerce and wannabe hip and not what we would have expected!
Amazing food and interesting shops. Finding parking is a nightmare....know your prices, some things are overpriced like the wire and bead crafts which are cheaper from the sidewalk vendors

Good Food. Haven't been to the Biscuit Mill for a while but we had friends from PE staying with us so we decided to take them to check it out. Food selection is excellent, everything from bacon and egg to oysters and champagne.Bought some really nice cheeses, breads and amazing chorizo. Our friends were really impressed.
Great Time. Such a great and diverse experience with friends. Beer, good food and music. There is always something to look at.

Interesting retro outlet. I have visited the Old Biscuit Mill since it was launched in recent years and always find it interesting.
Shops , coffee venues and restaurants change regularly but the character and themes are always retain a welcome vibe. All in all one of "the must visit" places in Cape Town.

Great vibes. The Old Biscuit Mill is probably one of the biggest surprises of Cape Town. I love how the area not only house the best restaurant in Africa (according to the World's best list) but also is home to some really great shops, from the chocolatier to the liquor store, the place simply has a unique personality that draws the attention of its visitors. This place is definitely a must see.

Great Saturday morning activity. A must do if you in Cape Town on a Saturday morning.A very busy activity with lots of different food to eat on the spot or take away.Get there early as it sometimes gets large groups visiting and seating is limited.Why not 5 stars - parking is a problem - you could Uber there and avoid.

MUST do Saturday morning activity in Cape Town!!. Amazing Saturday morning activity in Cape Town. Serves Mojitos and other cocktails from really early :) Selection of food is absolutely amazing, and there's a great vibe. Take cash, or SnapScan and go starving, ready to eat!! Try the fresh tuna stand (salad or with noodles) and the Belgian Waffles! Although everything is amazing...Take a lot of patience, there are very many people and you may ens up sitting on the pavement with all the other "Mill goers" to eat so rather wear pants!Do not skip this one!

Don't Miss this food treat. Sample good portions of almost any local food and beverage at this Saturday only festival of bakers, brewers, growers, vintners, fisherman and many others. Its crowded but moves politely. It opens early and closes at 2pm so don't arrive late. Take a cab and enjoy.

saturday morning must then.... there is the early afternoon. The food, the buzz, the fruit juices, the people. Great place to meet the local Capetonians and even some fashion and antiques. Always full of excited folk. Parking always a problem. Pay the parking attendants and move on.

Always delivers an amazing atmosphere. I visited my old haunt this past weekend! It was so good to see some familiar faces running their stalls after all this time and still producing such fine produce and eats and treats. Always a good idea to head at about 09:00am as you get to walk around freely without having to get through crowds. We had lots of seating to choose from...enjoyed some foodie delights and managed to leave before the crowds arrived. Great vibe and a delight to do on a Saturday morning.

Ensure this is on your Cape Town bucket list. Candle light, flowers, champagne, oysters, jazz: Saturday morning at the Old Biscuit Mill. So much fun.Make sure to visit the shops as well as the food stalls: great for good quality gifts. You may pay slightly more but the quality is better and there is no need to haggle. Finally, get there early!
Gourmet under roof!. Gourmet food, interesting people, a vibe beyond....! A MUST visit in Cape Town. Go hungry and with a camera....wonderful photo opportunities.....

World Class food court . It's just a Pitty it is so cramped and not more spacious.
A must visit though.
Food in abundance, exceptional quality.
Not suitable for small children, babies in prams anyone with difficulty walking.
Continues to be one of my favourite places in spite of the obstacles in getting around.
Hip, trendy, very local a great favourite.

A fun place to spend a few hours. Friends and I were here on a Saturday morning. Food stalls were thriving, a jazz band was playing, and the shops had many attractive (and inexpensive) things to buy. (I bought a red plastic necklace at Cristina's.)

Great way to spend a Saturday morning in Cape Town. Unbelievable food variety and quality. Try the mushroom skewer or the jelapino poppers, the paella or the crisp pizza with Parma ham, tomato, rocket and balsamic reduction covered in slivers of grated Parmesan! Wash it all down with a Jack Black lager, or one of the other liquid delights on offer.

It doesn't take the buscuit. Quite posh, no doubt expensive for SA, perhaps a bit of over-gentrification. But it is great.
Especially liked the food tent. Friendly vibrant and you did feel that quite a lot of manufacturing was growing locally to serve it.

Absolutely worth a visit - Must Do in Cape Town. Old Biscuit Mill is home to shops of young South African artists. Very nice to just look around and have a coffee.But even better - visiting the Mill on Saturdays! There's a Food Market from 9-14 that offers a lot of amazing international food. Absolutely worth a visit. You should skip breakfast and try as many things as possible here. They sell very good Dim Sum or fresh coconuts for example.

Still a great market to visit again and again . Went slightly late but the place was packed. Great food, drink and atmosphere. The one set back are the beggars that greet you when you arrive and leave and this is but unpleasant

Enjoyable afternoon wandering around the shops. The Old biscuit Mill is a great place to hang out for coffee or lunch or just a wander around all the quirky little shops.We spent a whole afternoon here with bags of little souvenirs you can't find anywhere else in SA.Definitely stop for a bite to eat in the deli, you can also order a fabulous coffee from espresso lab who then bring in to your table is the deli.
Overated. I find that the old biscuit mill is extremely overrated. I would much rather visit the route 44 market outside stellenbosch. Everything is overpriced. I find it to be a tad bit snooty

Very atmospheric and packed on a saturday in Summer. This is a great market for the foodies. They offer all sorts of treats including healthy options for banters, vegans and health nuts. It gets very busy so make sure you get there early!

Best Saturday food market ever with amazing local produce and arts and crafts too!. We visited the Old Biscuit Mill to take part in the Hint Hunt game and being a Saturday the food market was on too. The stalls were so colourful and the smells from the fresh produce was amazing. You could literally eat your way around the world here! There were also lots of locally brewed beers and the atmosphere was great. Lots of lovely arts and craft shops to visit and also home to the amazing Pot Luck Club (tapas style dining).Definitely worth a visit.

Go for the Saturday Market. We went to the Old Biscuit Mill specifically for the Saturday Market when local artisans sell their wares in the open courtyard. We were impressed by the quality and design of the clothing, shoes, bags, etc. displayed. The artists are very happy to tell you about their products and crafts and everything seemed to be reasonably priced for the quality. The Old Biscuit Mill itself was a bit of a disappointment with less shops than we had expected and merchandise more touristy. Adjacent to the Mill is a covered food market which sells produce, foodstuffs, cheese, etc. as well as prepared food. It all looked and smelled delightful.Caution--go early on Saturday. The street parking fills up quickly and consequently the streets become very clogged with traffic.

Amazing Saturday morning market. We love to go to the biscuit mill when we are in town especially if it's Saturday. Wonderful market with nice food and craft beer. You can even buy fresh produce and spice. The shops around are amazing and always nice to browse. A must do in Cape Town

Perfect way to kick off the weekend. The Old Biscuit Mill is a perfect place to get into gear for the weekend. It's festive, bustling, and filled with a wide range of handmade crafts and delicious food and drinks. Don't make the mistake of eating before coming, as you will immediately regret not being able to take full advantage of all the gastronomical delights that await you. Also, don't forget to bring a tote bag - plastic bags are nonexistant!

A Gastronomical Delight. This place has it all. I really mean has it all. You would thing you died and gone to food heaven. Beer, cider, wine, champs, fresh juice. Every possible food, pastry, chocolate, good bad and very, very bad. You must go, open on a Saturday morning. Did I mention they have other wonder handmade products.

A great place to spend a Saturday. We've just been to the Old Biscuit Mill and it is amazing! Lots of interesting and quirky shops with unusual items for sale and great food and drink as well. We ate in the deli and I had a Vegan Heaven, which was true to it's name! If we weren't flying home lang haul I would have bought some of the porcelain pottery and bowls which were so beautiful. I'd definitely recommend a visit here.

A saturday morning favourite. Absolutely love going there to get a nice brunch on saturdays! So much choice you won't go there just once. the food is delicious and fresh ( he belgian Waffles with chocolate banana and ice cream are my favourite ) Also loads of healthy options which is great.

Neighbourgoods Market. This market set at The Old Biscuit Mill has become a Cape Town institution. Five to ten minutes away from the inner city. Open on Saturdays from 09h00 – 14h00. Parking is in the street or at the school opposite the street (accessed by the street south of the market). One will find clean toilets and one ATM where one can withdraw cash.The food market offers a plethora of interesting food and drink for sale with live entertainment. Seating is provided. A décor and clothing market provides artistic flair, plus there are several shops at the Biscuit Mill with further shopping options. It is a very busy market, arrive as early as you can, take cash, keep a seat for your fellow diners and leave. The crowds are a bit too much. Don’t take a pram, wheelchair or pet.Ideal for buying a good loaf at bread to enjoy at home. Tourists love this market.

Great market and good food. A great place with excellent food. We've been here several times in the past and every time it is a overall good experience. The atmosphere is amazing and the people so friendly. We enjoy the food, good value for money. I find the clothing and other stalls a bit pricy.

Always a favourite . When ever I'm in Cape Town I try and get down to the Biscuit Mill. It never seases to amaze me how diverse and cosmopolitan the Biscuit Mill is. There is a food market where one can choose food and drink from around the world and and of course the local produce and drink. The bands make for a great vibe and it's a must if you enjoy people watching. Please note it is only open on a Saterday.
Wonderful food market on a Saturday. Beautiful food market with wonderful produce. Lots of art and crafty shops as well with interesting trinkets.
Great Market! All in One!. A great hangout spot! People watching spot! Drinks Spot! Great Food Spot! Atmosphere is amazing! Favourite thing to do on a Saturday after hiking up the mountain!

Great Saturday food market. We stopped in after the Greenpoint park run for a coffee and breakfast. It's a great market where certainly for breakfast you could get almost anything, our children enjoyed pancakes and croissants while we had a prego roll with chorizo and egg. The coffee was very good too. Highly recommended. Will give it a try for lunch some time soon, the craft beers, wine and lunch type menu items look great.

Must-do in Cape Town!. I went to the Old Biscuit Mill with a friend without expecting too much but it turned out to to be a wonderful afternoon! There is tons to do and see there, from little shops and cafes to an amazing tent full of food from all over the world. We very much enjoyed the diversity and also the atmosphere you can encounter there. It is ideal to spent a morning or even the whole day just strolling through the grounds looking for little gems which, I am certain, can always be found. It is also a great place to meet up with friends and have a nice chat over some incredible food although the fried chili that I ate was a bit too spicy ;) It can get very crowded, especially on the weekends, but this only goes to show how extremely popular the Old Biscuit Mill is - and justly so!
Fantastic market for food, drink, clothing, jewellery and crafts.. The entire market experience was amazing. We ate ourselves silly. The choices were extensive. Everyone was so helpful and friendly.

A great place where locals meet the world.. I have visited the Old biscuit mill twice in the recent two months, as I was new to the city, a few friends recommended me to this well-known market. When you walk into the market, you are immediately drawn to the lovely scent of coffee from the pop-up cafes, as you walk into the market's courtyard, you are exposed to so much scents that will make your mouth water. The live music and laughter from the visitors invites you to go further. Inside market, from waffles to dim sum, pizzas to kimchi, you will witness food around the world made fresh in front of you, wines from the finest vineyards, fresh ingredients to stock up your kitchen. It is unquestionably the foodie heaven.Pros: Tons of amazing food that will spoil your senses. If you are looking for rare ingredient to experiment in the kitchen this is the place to find them. (I have found plantain, truffles, fresh duck...) Cons: The area is heavily gentrified, the exact same food item at different market will cost a lot more here. Parking on street is difficult to find, nearest on-street parking from blocks away will cost you a good R20. Beware of pickpockets, as this is perhaps the busiest place to be on a Sat.Tip: Bring cash, draw cash ahead before going to the market, the only StandardBank ATM on site is always busy with queues like it's China. Download snapscan if you want to avoid taking too much cash. If you don't want to get there early, then try not to drive, take public transport, I mean Uber.

Nice place for food and art. I enjoyed trying the different foods that were done fresh from the various stalls. There was also various shops having arty/historical items that were interesting to learn about.

CPT must do. This place is just awesome. They have all sorts of fresh food you can get in stands from sandwiches to sushi. Not only is the food amazing, but they have great shopping stands set up with good stuff. Only open on Saturdays but definitely worth a visit if you are in Cape Town.
